meanings.definition: One who files documents or paperwork.
meanings.sent1: The filer organized all the papers in the office.
meanings.sent2: The filer kept all the important documents in order.
meanings.sent3: The filer made sure all the papers were neatly arranged, like a puzzle.
meanings.sent4: She was a filer, turning chaos into order with each document she touched.
meanings.sent5: The filer's desk was a masterpiece of organization, each paper finding its perfect place.

meanings.definition: A tool used for smoothing or shaping a surface.
meanings.sent1: He used the filer to smooth out the rough edges of the wood.
meanings.sent2: The filer was essential for creating a perfectly shaped sculpture.
meanings.sent3: The filer glided over the surface, leaving it as smooth as glass.
meanings.sent4: The filer was like a magic wand, transforming rough surfaces into works of art.
meanings.sent5: With the filer in hand, he sculpted the material with precision and finesse.

meanings.definition: A person or thing that files or sharpens.
meanings.sent1: The filer expertly sharpened the blades of the tools in the workshop.
meanings.sent2: The filer was a master at keeping all the knives razor-sharp.
meanings.sent3: The filer's sharpening skills were so good, even the dullest blades became like new.
meanings.sent4: He was the filer of the group, always ensuring everything was in top condition.
meanings.sent5: The filer's precision in sharpening was unmatched, turning blunt edges into cutting perfection.
